name: Kung Pao Chicken
instruction:
1. Cut boneless, skinless chicken breast into bite-sized pieces. 
2. Marinate the chicken with soy sauce, rice vinegar, and cornstarch for 15 minutes. 
3. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. 
4. Stir-fry the chicken until cooked through. 
5. Add chopped garlic, ginger, and dried chili peppers. 
6. Stir-fry for another minute. 
7. Add peanuts and stir-fry for a few more seconds. 
8. Mix in a sauce made of soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and cornstarch. 
9. Cook until the sauce thickens. 
10. Garnish with green onions and serve hot.

name: Tacos al Pastor
instruction:
1. Marinate thinly sliced pork shoulder with a mixture of pineapple juice, achiote paste, garlic, and spices for at least 2 hours. 
2. Heat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat. 
3. Cook the marinated pork until browned and cooked through. 
4. Warm corn tortillas on the grill or in a dry skillet. 
5. Fill each tortilla with the cooked pork. 
6. Top with diced onions, chopped cilantro, and a squeeze of lime. 
7. Serve with salsa and guacamole on the side.

name: Margherita Pizza
instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C). 
2. Roll out the pizza dough into a round shape. 
3. Spread tomato sauce evenly on the dough. 
4. Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese on top. 
5. Add fresh basil leaves. 
6. Bake in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. 
7. Remove from the oven, let it cool slightly, and serve.

name: Sushi Rolls
instruction:
1. Cook sushi rice according to package instructions. 
2. Lay a sheet of nori seaweed on a bamboo sushi mat. 
3. Moisten your hands with water and spread a thin layer of rice over the nori, leaving a small border at the top. 
4. Arrange your choice of fillings (such as sliced raw fish, avocado, cucumber, or cooked shrimp) in a line across the rice. 
5. Roll the sushi tightly using the bamboo mat, applying gentle pressure. 
6. Moisten the top border of the nori with water to seal the roll. 
7. Repeat with more nori and fillings. 
8. Slice the sushi rolls into bite-sized pieces. 
9. Serve with soy sauce, pickled ginger, and wasabi.

name: Butter Chicken
instruction:
1. Marinate boneless chicken pieces in yogurt, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for at least 1 hour. 
2. Heat oil and butter in a pan over medium heat. 
3. Sauté onions until golden brown. 
4. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for another minute. 
5. Add tomato puree, turmeric, chili powder, and garam masala. 
6. Cook the sauce for 5-6 minutes. 
7. Add the marinated chicken and cook until tender. 
8. Stir in heavy cream and fenugreek leaves. 
9. Simmer for a few minutes. 
10. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with naan bread or rice.
